result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter J, Monnier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Peter J, Monnier is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Peter J, Monnier was found guilty of Intentionally Mistreat Animals [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.02.
  • Peter J, Monnier was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant granted Huber privileges under rules and regulations of the Columbia County Jail, defendant may serve sentence in Dane County on E.M.P.

9:08 A.M., Defendant Peter J, Monnier in court with attorney Mark David Lawton.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court sentences defendant to: Ct. 1, 30 days jail w/Huber, Jail start date 2/20/17 at 5:00 A.M., may serve sentence in Dane County on E.M.P., $443.00 costs, 60 days to pay or payment plan, defendant to submit DNA Sample, Ct. 3, 60 days jail w/Huber, consecutive to Ct. 1, $243.00 costs, 60 days to pay or payment plan, defendant to submit DNA Sample, 5 days sentence credit, 9:16 A.M.
